metadata.title: CVE-2022-3437 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability was found in Samba within theGSSAPI unwrap_des() and unwrap_des3() routines of Heimdal. The DES andTriple-DES decryption routines in the Heimdal GSSAPI library allow alength-limited write buffer overflow on malloc() allocated memory whenpresented with a maliciously small packet. This flaw allows a remote userto send specially crafted malicious data to the application, possiblyresulting in a denial of service (DoS) attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3437` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
python3-samba - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: heimdal package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
samba package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.15.13+dfsg-0ubuntu1').
